topic: Uncovering the heart of my Nana’s saltwater stories

ideas.title: The Snapper Whisperer
ideas.premise: Nana tries to teach a grandson, raised on Brunswick lattes, how to 'talk' to snapper in Port Phillip Bay, with hilarious (and fishy) results.
ideas.why_funny: Juxtaposition of hipster culture with old-school fishing traditions is inherently funny.

ideas.title: Saltwater Secrets of St Kilda Pier
ideas.premise: A cartoon of Nana and grandson visiting St Kilda Pier, where she recounts tall tales of penguins stealing her hot chips.
ideas.why_funny: The absurdity of penguins as hot chip thieves. Everyone loves St Kilda Pier.

ideas.title: The Great Brighton Bathing Box Mystery
ideas.premise: Nana’s stories lead her grandchildren on a wild goose chase around the Brighton Bathing Boxes searching for 'pirate treasure'.
ideas.why_funny: Everyone recognizes the bathing boxes; treasure hunt adds a child-like sense of adventure.

ideas.title: Frankston Foreshore Fables
ideas.premise: Nana exaggerates stories about mythical sea creatures she supposedly encountered on Frankston foreshore.
ideas.why_funny: Over-the-top, unbelievable stories combined with a mundane location.

ideas.title: Queen Victoria Market Mermaids
ideas.premise: Nana convinces her grandkids that the fishmongers at Queen Victoria Market are secretly mermaids in disguise.
ideas.why_funny: The surprising connection between a fish market and mermaids is unexpected.

ranking: Saltwater Secrets of St Kilda Pier
